step.context: \text{Which one the correct way of finding \dfrac{dy}{dx}}?

step.tex:
\dfrac{dy}{dx} = 2 \tan^{-1} x \cdot \left(\dfrac{1}{1 + x^2}\right)\\ \left(1 + x^2\right)\dfrac{dy}{dx} = 2 \tan^{-1} x\\ \text{Diffrentiating the above equaton we get}\\ \begin{align} \dfrac{d \left(\left(1 + x^2\right)\dfrac{dy}{dx}\right)}{dx} = \dfrac{d \left(2 \tan^{-1} x\right)}{dx}\\ \left(1 + x^2\right) \dfrac{d^2y}{dx^2} +2x \, \dfrac{dy}{dx} = 2 \left(\dfrac{1}{1 + x^2}\right)\\ \left(1 + x^2\right)^2 \dfrac{d^2y}{dx^2} +2x \,\left(1 + x^2\right) \dfrac{dy}{dx} = 2 \\
\end{align}
